content.description: This route starts at the west-northwest edge of the Indian Head Buttress and wraps around the south edge.
content.protection: Trad protection can be used. However lower in the route, the rock is more flaky.  This does not have fixed top anchors and will tyoically be anchored off the tree line across a 12' chasm.  Bring static rope for TR anchor for 30-35' span.
content.location: This is the west facing front edge of Indian Head Bluff, one of the most notable images of the Mississippi Palisade Park.  You will be climbing right up the nose!

content.description: North face climb up the Indian Head tower.  Starts in the center of the north side and follows straight up the center crack the angles right.  Leads to a grassy ledge before finishing the remaining 15' to top out.
content.protection: TP Anchors to the main buttress area across a 12' chasm which makes this route a PG for TR anchoring.  There are no bolts in route or on top.  There is a few large rock notches to redirect anchors.
content.location: Location is at the Indian Head Buttress area.  Top Rope anchoring is accessable from side access approach from the northside.

content.description: Short route on the south corner of the Indian Head main face.  Nice holds and simple to belay from top or bottom.
content.protection: No bolts.  Plenty of trees on top.
content.location: This route is on the main face behind the tower. It faces South West on the corner.

content.description: This is a short route from the access area between the tower and main face of Indian Head climbing area.
content.location: Center access from the top of the Indian Head face.  there is an access route from the center face area wrapping around from the north side down into the chasm between the face and tower of Indian Head.

content.description: This could possibly be classified as a moderate fourth class scamper.  Starts at the northeast corner and follows narrow ledges to the top of Indian Head Tower.
content.protection: Could use some traditional pro.  Has 2 anchors with chains at the top of this climb on the ledge just above access climb
content.location: Access to this area is from the top of Indian Head Buttress.  YOu can get to it from a moderate hike up the north side of hill.

content.description: Know this area? Click "Improve This Page" and add a description!
